text: "I could not believe how much happier I was now that I had Merle in my life," Sarah Miller writes, about her adopted blue heeler. "Then she started to slow down." https://t.co/w1fjUibiun

name: NewYorker

text: In gentrifying neighborhoods, empty houses are sitting ducks. For cheap security, real-estate companies hire the homeless to guard expensive properties. The rules are simple: don’t host guests, don’t talk to anyone, and don’t leave. https://t.co/hDVYe8JRwY
